bugs.title: CVE-2020-35521 libtiff: Memory allocation failure in tiff2rgba [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2020-35521 libtiff: Memory allocation failure in tiff2rgba [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2020-35521 libtiff: Memory allocation failure in tiff2rgba

long_desc.thetext:
A flaw was found in libtiff 4.1.0 and before. Due to a memory allocation failure in tif_read.c, a crafted TIFF file can lead to an abort, resulting in denial of service.

References:

https://gitlab.com/libtiff/libtiff/-/merge_requests/165
https://gitlab.com/libtiff/libtiff/-/commit/b5a935d96b21cda0f434230cdf8ca958cd8b4eef

Created libtiff tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1932035]


Created mingw-libtiff tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1932036]

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8

Via RHSA-2021:4241 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4241

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2020-35521

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

bugs.title: CVE-2020-35522 libtiff: Memory allocation failure in tiff2rgba [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2020-35522 libtiff: Memory allocation failure in tiff2rgba [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2020-35522 libtiff: Memory allocation failure in tiff2rgba

long_desc.thetext:
A flaw was found in libtiff 4.1.0 and before. Due to a memory allocation failure in tif_read.c, a crafted TIFF file can lead to an abort, resulting in denial of service.

This is a different flaw from CVE-2020-35521

References:

https://gitlab.com/libtiff/libtiff/-/merge_requests/165
https://gitlab.com/libtiff/libtiff/-/commit/98a254f5b92cea22f5436555ff7fceb12afee84d

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

bugs.title: CVE-2020-35523 libtiff: Integer overflow in tif_getimage.c [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2020-35523 libtiff: Integer overflow in tif_getimage.c [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2020-35523 libtiff: Integer overflow in tif_getimage.c

long_desc.thetext:
In libtiff 4.1.0, an integer overflow vulnerability exists in tif_getimage.c file. By enticing a user to open a craft TIFF file, an attacker may leverage the vulnerability to inject and execute arbitrary code.

References:

https://gitlab.com/libtiff/libtiff/-/commit/c8d613ef497058fe653c467fc84c70a62a4a71b2
https://gitlab.com/libtiff/libtiff/-/merge_requests/160

Created libtiff tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1932043]


Created mingw-libtiff tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1932042]

External References:

https://gitlab.com/libtiff/libtiff/-/commit/c8d613ef497058fe653c467fc84c70a62a4a71b2
https://gitlab.com/libtiff/libtiff/-/merge_requests/160

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8

Via RHSA-2021:4241 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4241

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2020-35523

bugs.title: CVE-2020-35524 libtiff: Heap-based buffer overflow in TIFF2PDF tool [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2020-35524 libtiff: Heap-based buffer overflow in TIFF2PDF tool [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2020-35524 libtiff: Heap-based buffer overflow in TIFF2PDF tool

long_desc.thetext:
A flaw was found in libtiff 4.1.0. A heap-based buffer overflow exists in the handling of TIFF images in libtiff's TIFF2PDF tool. A specially crafted TIFF file can lead to arbitrary code execution.

References:

https://gitlab.com/rzkn/libtiff/-/commit/7be2e452ddcf6d7abca88f41d3761e6edab72b22
https://gitlab.com/libtiff/libtiff/-/merge_requests/159

Created libtiff tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1932046]


Created mingw-libtiff tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1932045]

External References:

https://gitlab.com/rzkn/libtiff/-/commit/7be2e452ddcf6d7abca88f41d3761e6edab72b22
https://gitlab.com/libtiff/libtiff/-/merge_requests/159

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8

Via RHSA-2021:4241 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4241

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2020-35524
